Content: Since some systems may fracture without falling into anarchy a
different system should be choosen to limit the number of system
administrations. For example small colonies should not be treated as
administrations but as minors, which may then assimilated into an
system administration (flipping back and forth may still cause a

problem).
The problem disappears if small colonies are unable to
survive on their own (e.g. Asteroid mining bases running out of food).
